{"metadata":{"objective":"Beginning with a compelling introduction","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"CS17/4/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">Traveling to another world</span><br /><br />You decide to enter a contest run by the local movie theater.&nbsp; All you have to do is write a great essay about why it is better to go out to the movies than to stay home and watch TV,&nbsp;and you will win ten free movie tickets.<br /><br />You have a thesis statement and lots of great ideas organized into a writing web from the mini-lessons in the <em>Getting Started</em> section, but you are stuck on how to begin your essay!&nbsp; You need information on creating an introduction.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A diagram shows the parts of an essay:  the introduction, body paragraph 1, body paragraph 2, body paragraph 3, and the conclusion.  The introduction is the first paragraph.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"1","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"2"},"leftText":"<p>The introductory paragraph should</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>get your reader interested in the topic.</li><li>give the reader background information.</li><li>include your thesis statement.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul><p><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" style=\"width: 27px; height: 27px;\" />&nbsp; <a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS17/4/Pictureit_Compellingintroduction.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=no,dependent=yes,width=800,left=100,height=600,top=50'); return false;\">Beginning with a compelling introduction: Picture it!</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS17/4/Screen_reader_picture_it_compelling_introduction.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/accessible_icon.png\" style=\"width: 17px; height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of beginning with a compelling introduction, opens in a new tab</span></a><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of an introductory paragraph.  The first part is a sentence or two to get your reader interested.  The second part is a sentence or two of background information.  The last part is your thesis statement.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Parts of an introduction"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"3"},"leftText":"<p>Use your first sentence or two to &quot;hook&quot; your reader. There are many ways to do this.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp; <img alt=\"In an introductory paragraph, the first sentence or two that gets your reader interested is sometimes called a &quot;hook.&quot;\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Getting your reader interested in the topic"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"rightText":"<p>Is Saturday night best spent out at the movies or at home on the couch?</p><p>Have you ever wondered what it would be like to visit the rain forest?</p>","leftText":"<p>You could begin with a question.<br />&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"5"},"leftText":"<p>Or you may choose to begin with a sensory description.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Imagine yourself sinking&nbsp;into comfortable stadium seating, absorbing the soundtrack in surround-sound, and munching on hot buttered popcorn.</p><p>Picture yourself in a steamy tropical setting, surrounded by the scent of living plants, earth, and warm rain.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<p>Or you could begin with a quote.&nbsp; It could be from a famous person or a not-so- famous person.&nbsp; If you use a quote, remember to<br />&nbsp;</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>enclose the quote in quotation marks.</li><li>include an in-text citation.</li><li>add a list of references as the final page of your document.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul>","rightText":"<p>My mother always advised, &quot;A night out at the movies is like traveling to another world.&quot;</p><p>Even though he was born in the last century, my grandfather had some wise ideas. He often said, &quot;If you protect the rain forest, you will save the planet.&quot;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"leftText":"<p>You could also begin with a bold statement.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>There is no doubt that going to the movies is better than staying home on a Saturday night.</p><p>If we do not protect the rain forest, the &quot;Lungs of the Earth&quot; will soon breathe their last breath.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<p>Try creating your own questions, sensory descriptions, quotes, and bold statements to draw your reader into the essay.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p><br />My mother always advised, &quot;A night out at the movies is like traveling to another world.&quot;&nbsp; She was convinced that the big screen could transport us out of everyday life and into another time and place.<br />.</p><p>.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"9"},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Careful!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><p>Do not start with a sentence that directly states what you plan to write about.&nbsp; Instead, write a sentence that suggests it.&nbsp; Do&nbsp;not include the personal pronoun,&nbsp;I,&nbsp;in your introductory sentence.&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\" style=\"color:#F79A1F;font-weight:bold;\">x</span></td><td><span class=\"marker\">In this essay, I will be telling you about</span> how a skateboard park helps kids socialize, exercise, and stay safe.</td></tr><tr><td><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v</span></td><td>Skateboard parks help kids socialize, exercise, and stay safe.</td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"10"},"leftText":"<p>Background information will let your reader know enough about the topic so that he can understand your ideas.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of an introductory paragraph. The first part is a hook or sentence or two to get your reader interested.  The part that follows the hook is the background information.  The last part is your thesis statement.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Providing background information"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"11"},"leftText":"<p>The background you provide will be different for every essay and every purpose.&nbsp; The background information should give the reader basic information about&nbsp;what you are discussing.<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">ASK YOURSELF: Deciding what background to provide<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">&nbsp;,</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><p>What does my reader need to know about this topic?</p><p>What might&nbsp;my reader not know about this topic?</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"12"},"leftText":"<p>You are writing an essay for movie theater executives.&nbsp; They are a&nbsp;group of experts.&nbsp; These readers already know a lot about the subject.&nbsp; You want to be sure your information is correct.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Background information ideas:</span></p><p>Everyone loves TV, but many Americans still prefer movies.</p><p>Teens and young adults are always looking at phones (small screens), but also attend movies to view entertainment on large screens.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"13"},"leftText":"<p>You add the background information to your paragraph after the opening sentences. <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">The background information is, Although Americans may seem to be absorbed by TV, children, teens, and adults still enjoy going out to the movies and experiencing that opportunity to visit other worlds. Teens and young adults seem to be glued to their phone screens, but when a new movie opens, you can see them in the audience, mesmerized by the happenings on the big screen.</span><br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p>My mother always advised, &quot;A night out at the movies is like traveling to another world.&quot; She was convinced that the big screen could transport us out of everyday life and into another time and place.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Although Americans may seem to be absorbed by TV, children, teens, and adults still enjoy going out to the movies and experiencing that opportunity to visit other worlds.&nbsp; Teens and young adults seem to be glued to their phone screens, but when a new movie opens, you can see them in the audience, mesmerized by the happenings on the big screen.</span></p><p>.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"14"},"leftText":"<p>Be careful not to include too much information.&nbsp; Including too much background information may cause your reader to lose interest.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Too much information:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>The 2012 movie, <em>Jig</em>, tells the story of the physically and emotionally demanding world of competitive Irish dance.&nbsp; The film follows six contestants on their paths to the prized worldwide competition in this sport.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Irish dance can be traced back 2,000 years to the Celts, who brought traditional dances from Europe.&nbsp; The changes and trends in Irish dance follow the migratory patterns of groups who established themselves on the island now known as Ireland.&nbsp; Each century brought new trends in native dance.&nbsp; Today,</span> dancers from all over the world work tirelessly all year to earn a coveted opportunity to dance in&nbsp; the world competition.&nbsp; The six young people profiled in <em>Jig</em> show stories of determination and perseverance, leaving the viewer breathlessly wondering who will take first place on the podium.</td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"15"},"leftText":"<p>Background information should tell the reader just enough new information so that he is able to understand the rest of your writing.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Just enough new information:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>The 2012 movie, <em>Jig</em>, tells the story of the physically and emotionally demanding world of competitive Irish dance. The film follows six contestants on their paths to the prized world-wide competition in this sport. Dancers from all over the world work tirelessly all year to earn a coveted opportunity to dance in the world competition. The six young people profiled in <em>Jig</em> show stories of determination and perseverance, leaving the viewer breathlessly wondering who will take first place on the podium.</td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"16"},"leftText":"<p>The thesis statement included in your introduction lets your readers know what you will write about and what your opinion is on the topic. &nbsp;The thesis statement&nbsp;is often the final sentence in the introduction.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of an introductory paragraph. The first part is a hook or sentence or two to get your reader interested.  The second part is the background information.  The thesis statement follows the background information.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Adding your thesis statement"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"17"},"leftText":"<p>Often a thesis statement names three big ideas or&nbsp;reasons that you plan to write about.&nbsp; Each one will become the topic of one of your body paragraphs.<br /><br />When you write about these three reasons, you will introduce them in the same order as they occur in your thesis statement.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement with three reasons:</span></p><p>Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort&nbsp; to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"18"},"leftText":"<p>The thesis statement lets the reader know what to expect in the next parts of your essay.&nbsp;<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\"> You add it to the end of the introductory paragraph.</span><br /><br />If you need more information on thesis statements, review the mini-lesson <em>Developing a strong thesis statement.</em>&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p>My mother always advised, &quot;A night out at the movies is like traveling to another world.&quot;&nbsp; She was convinced that the big screen could transport us out of everyday life and into another time and place.&nbsp; Although Americans may seem to be absorbed by TV, children, teens, and adults still enjoy going out to the movies and experiencing that opportunity to visit other worlds.&nbsp; Teens and young adults seem to be glued to their phone screens, but when a new movie opens, you can see them in the audience, mesmerized by the happenings on the big screen.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>","headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"19"},"leftText":"<p>There are lots of different ways to structure your introduction.<br /><br />Some writers may choose to begin with the thesis statement.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p><span class=\"marker\">Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time.</span>&nbsp;<br />.<br />.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>","headerText":"Another way to structure the introduction"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"20"},"leftText":"<p>If you decide to begin your introduction with the thesis statement, follow it&nbsp;with the background information.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p>Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is&nbsp;a more active use of my time.&nbsp;<span class=\"marker\"> Although Americans may seem to be absorbed by TV, children, teens, and adults still enjoy going out to the movies and experiencing that opportunity to visit other worlds.&nbsp; Teens and young adults seem to be glued to their phone screens, but when a new movie opens, you can see them in the audience, mesmerized by the happenings on the big screen.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"21"},"leftText":"<p>Then add a transitional sentence that connects your ideas to the rest of your essay. <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">The transitional sentence is, When you are tempted to spend yet another night watching TV, think about all that can be experienced by heading out to the movies!</span><br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p>Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time. Although Americans may seem to be absorbed by TV, children, teens, and adults still enjoy going out to the movies and experiencing that opportunity to visit other worlds.&nbsp; Teens and young adults seem to be glued to their phone screens, but when a new movie opens, you can see them in the audience, mesmerized by the happenings on the big screen.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">When you are tempted to spend yet another night watching TV, think about all that can be experienced by heading out to the movies!</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"22"},"leftText":"<p>As a writer, you should try different approaches to your introductions.&nbsp; Create the type of introduction that communicates your message best.&nbsp; Don&#39;t be afraid to experiment!<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"23"},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><p>A winning introduction will</p><ul><li>get the your reader excited about your topic.</li><li>give your reader needed background information.</li><li>tell the reader your plan for writing.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p><br />If you include these things in your introduction, the contest judges will be eager to read the rest of your work!</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0},"leftText":"<p>Here is your introductory paragraph.<br /><br />If you need more help, go back to the <em>Writing a winning essay </em>menu and choose one of the other mini-lessons to learn about writing your first draft and revising your essay to make it better.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br />Why Going to the Movies Is Better Than Watching TV</span></p><p>My mother always advised, &quot;A night out at the movies is like traveling to another world.&quot; She was convinced that the big screen could transport us out of everyday life and into another time and place.&nbsp; Although Americans may seem to be absorbed by TV, children, teens, and adults still enjoy going out to the movies and experiencing that opportunity to visit other worlds.&nbsp; Teens and young adults seem to be glued to their phone screens, but when a new movie opens, you can see them in the audience, mesmerized by the happenings on the big screen.&nbsp; Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
